When a high-priority update job runs out of sequence, it may not have the necessary input or context to process data correctly. As a result, there's a significant risk that the job completes its processing with invalid data. This directly impacts data integrity and can have serious consequences for the organization, especially if decisions are made based on the erroneous data.

Es importante realizar evaluaciones de riesgos en cada etapa del SDLC para identificar y mitigar riesgos de manera continua y eficaz, asegurando que los mecanismos de control estén bien establecidos

Selected Answer: A
While conducting risk assessments at each stage of the life cycle (option B) is valuable to continuously monitor and manage risks throughout the project, addressing risks early (prior to system development) sets a strong foundation for effective risk management across all subsequent stages of the SDLC.

Therefore, option A, performing a risk assessment prior to system development, is often considered the most beneficial stage in the SDLC to conduct a risk assessment.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST source of information for an IS auditor to use when determining whether an organization's information security policy is adequate?

choices.B: Validate compliance with the risk acceptance process.
choices.A: Document noncompliance with the agreed-upon plan.
choices.C: Update the enterprise risk register to reflect the observation.
choices.D: Check for implementation of compensating controls.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Organisational management can choose to accept the risk of not implementing certain controls that may apply . With risk acceptance, management acknowledges the risk and agrees to move forward despite the potential impact.
